newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Akzo Nobel sees fewer extraordinaries.
newsitem.headline: Akzo Nobel sees fewer extraordinaries.

text.p: Chemicals group Akzo Nobel said on Thursday that it had amended its accounting policies in order to reduce the effect of extraordinaries on the group bottom line.

"In all likelihood there will be fewer extraordinary items in the future, as these will only pertain to matters related to the group as a whole, such as sweeping reorganisations," Akzo Chairman Cees van Lede told a results news conference.
He said that in the past the company's net profits had been difficult to predict because of substantial extraordinary charges.
Under the new system extraordinary items for the 26 individual business units would be accounted for under the business unit itself and not extrapolated to the group bottom line, he said.
